result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Raymond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amanda L Raymond is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amanda L Raymond was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees. You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

Defendant Amanda L Raymond in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 13CF42.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 2 in 14CF33, Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Will also find DE guilty in 13CF42.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.   Court will order sentence withheld, 2 years probation, will complete an AODA assessment and follow thru with recommendations of DOC, will pay CC's in both cases.
